Articles.Content:
For some reason, all the control surfaces forwards of my CoM are doing the exact inverse of what the ones behind it are doing, so when I pitch up, the front pitches down and I don't actually turn. Any idea why it's doing this? Am I forgetting to turn something off or something, or is something else?

Thank you for your time.

Edited May 5, 2015 by Mister Kingdom
Try disabling the front control surfaces from pitch. I don't remember if there is still an "invert" control, but sounds like it needs to be toggled.

Because that's what it should be doing. If not, are you sure they're in front of your CoM? Screenies would be very helpful here.

Right, thank you, yes it's doing that. Is this a new thing? I'll get some screenshots when I have the time, bit busy with school for the next few hours. Oh, and they are definitely in front and behind of my CoM; they're literally the foremost and backmost parts of the craft.

Thank you, you've solved the problem.

Edited May 5, 2015 by Mister Kingdom
Yeah, if it like that diagram, then that is how it is supposed to work. Fairly sure it is not new though.
